verses.text: Behold my servant , whom I uphold ; mine elect , \add in whom\add* my soul delighteth ; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
He shall not cry , nor lift up , nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.

A bruised reed shall he not break , and the smoking flax shall he not quench : he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.\f + \fr 42.3 \ft smoking: or, dimly burning\f*\f + \fr 42.3 \ft quench: Heb. quench it\f*
He shall not fail nor be discouraged , till he have set judgment in the earth : and the isles shall wait for his law.\f + \fr 42.4 \ft discouraged: Heb. broken\f* \p

¶ Thus saith God the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, he that created the heavens , and stretched them out ; he that spread forth the earth , and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:
I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* have called thee in righteousness , and will hold thine hand , and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people , for a light of the Gentiles ;
To open the blind eyes , to bring out the prisoners from the prison , \add and\add* them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: that \add is\add* my name : and my glory will I not give to another , neither my praise to graven images.
Behold, the former things are come to pass , and new things do I declare : before they spring forth I tell you of them.

Sing unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* a new song , \add and\add* his praise from the end of the earth , ye that go down to the sea , and all that is therein ; the isles , and the inhabitants thereof.\f + \fr 42.10 \ft all…: Heb. the fulness thereof\f*

Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up \add their voice\add*, the villages \add that\add* Kedar doth inhabit : let the inhabitants of the rock sing , let them shout from the top of the mountains.
Let them give glory unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and declare his praise in the islands. \p

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall go forth as a mighty man , he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war : he shall cry , yea, roar ; he shall prevail against his enemies.\f + \fr 42.13 \ft prevail: or, behave himself mightily\f*

I have long time holden my peace ; I have been still , \add and\add* refrained myself: \add now\add* will I cry like a travailing woman ; I will destroy and devour at once.\f + \fr 42.14 \ft devour: Heb. swallow, or, sup up\f*
I will make waste mountains and hills , and dry up all their herbs ; and I will make the rivers islands , and I will dry up the pools.

And I will bring the blind by a way \add that\add* they knew not; I will lead them in paths \add that\add* they have not known : I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.\f + \fr 42.16 \ft straight: Heb. into straightness\f* \p
¶ They shall be turned back , they shall be greatly ashamed , that trust in graven images , that say to the molten images , Ye \add are\add* our gods. \p
Hear , ye deaf ; and look , ye blind , that ye may see.

Who \add is\add* blind , but my servant ? or deaf , as my messenger \add that\add* I sent ? who \add is\add* blind as \add he that is\add* perfect , and blind as the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* servant ?
Seeing many things , but thou observest not; opening the ears , but he heareth not.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; he will magnify the law , and make \add it\add* honourable.\f + \fr 42.21 \ft it: or, him\f*

But this \add is\add* a people robbed and spoiled ; \add they are\add* all of them snared in holes , and they are hid in prison houses : they are for a prey , and none delivereth ; for a spoil , and none saith , Restore.\f + \fr 42.22 \ft they are all…: or, in snaring all the young men of them\f*\f + \fr 42.22 \ft for a spoil: Heb. a treading\f*
Who among you will give ear to this? \add who\add* will hearken and hear for the time to come ?\f + \fr 42.23 \ft for…: Heb. for the after time?\f*

Who gave Jacob for a spoil , and Israel to the robbers ? did not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, he against whom we have sinned ? for they would not walk in his ways , neither were they obedient unto his law.

Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger , and the strength of battle : and it hath set him on fire round about , yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid \add it\add* not to heart.
